page.title: 02ROOSERECK AND RAMPSIDE
page.content: This area is mainly sand and the rest of the land is used for farming. This area is not densley populated and the main inhabitants live along the coastline with only a few farms and houses scattered inland. In this part of the area there are not many amenities. Only a golf course, a caravan site and water sports exist which tend to attract holiday makers rather than residents. Cars are a vital form of transport to many people and the local bus service accommodates those able to drive. The climate can be described as: temperate, with a pronounced marine influence. Most of the old people have friends or relatives in the area to help them out when its cold and when they are in difficulty. At the end of Autumn the area is prone to flooding and the houses are often enveloped in
